meanings.definition: Not in a way that is characteristic of academic study or learning.
meanings.sent1: She approached the project unacademically, relying on her intuition rather than research.
meanings.sent2: He unacademically skipped class to go to the beach with his friends.
meanings.sent3: The student unacademically tried to solve the math problem by guessing the answer.
meanings.sent4: Her essay was unacademically written, lacking any references or citations.
meanings.sent5: The professor frowned upon her unacademically written thesis, filled with personal opinions instead of facts.

meanings.definition: Lacking in academic rigor or standards.
meanings.sent1: The unacademically written paper received a low grade from the teacher.
meanings.sent2: He was known for his unacademically approach to studying, often relying on last-minute cramming.
meanings.sent3: The unacademically decorated classroom had posters of cartoons instead of educational material.
meanings.sent4: Her unacademically structured argument fell apart under scrutiny.
meanings.sent5: The unacademically trained team struggled to compete against more prepared opponents.
